intro: Corylopsis sinensis var. calvescens, commonly known as the Chinese lantern bush, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is primarily due to its striking floral display.
